channel.title: Virus in client?
channel.description:
Everytime I try and run or extract a 718+ client, many different ones, not just one, I get a virus detected in one of the class files:
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/U5KV3ve.png[/img]
Is this real? Or just a false positive?

item.title: Virus in client?
item.dc:creator: @arceus70 arceus70
item.description:
@arceus70 wrote:

Does this mean i have to find another matrix client?? o-o

Read full topic

item.title: Virus in client?
item.dc:creator: @winK winK
item.description:
@winK wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:5, topic:540276”]I’ll try to sum this up for you OP, basically it allows the client to bypass the security manager in the web deployed form e.g applet. Since you are probably running this in a local environment this doesn’t really matter at all.[/quote]ty

Read full topic

item.title: Virus in client?
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

I’ll try to sum this up for you OP, basically it allows the client to bypass the security manager in the web deployed form e.g applet. Since you are probably running this in a local environment this doesn’t really matter at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus in client?
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

http://pastebin.com/6zQK3TVS
I’m guessing it’s because of this?

    static void method50123(int x) {
                try {
                        Class var_class = java.lang.ClassLoader.class;
                        Field field = var_class.getDeclaredField("nativeLibraries");
                        Class var_class_124_ = java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject.class;
                        Method method = var_class_124_.getDeclaredMethod("setAccessible", (new Class[] { Boolean.TYPE }));
                        method.invoke(field, new Object[] { Boolean.TRUE });
                } catch (Throwable throwable) {
                        /* empty */
                }
        }

Anyway most of these clients have a backdoor in them that lets anyone execute anything they want. (Through the server -> client packet system)

Read full topic

item.title: Virus in client?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

This is an unspecified vulnerability in the JRE component in Oracle Java SE 7 Update 21 and earlier, 6 Update 45 and earlier, and 5.0 Update 45 and earlier, and OpenJDK 7. It allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors related to 2D. If your version of Java is up to date I guess you’re fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Virus in client?
item.dc:creator: @SmdScape SmdScape
item.description:
@SmdScape wrote:

If it happens in many, then you should ignore it.
It may just be the methods within the class itself.

Or, you can look through Class52.java and see if there’s anything sketchy in there.

Read full topic
